person.persName: Oliver Otis Howard (Major General (U.S. Army) and Commissioner of Bureau of Refugees, Freedmen, and Abandoned Lands)

body.p: Major General (U.S. Army) and clergyman. Maine native. Son of Rowland Bailey Howard and Eliza Otis Howard. Married to Elizabeth Ann Waite on February 14, 1855. Father of Guy Howard, Grace E. Howard, James W. Howard, and Chancy O. Howard. Student at Bowdoin College in Brunswick, Maine, in 1850. Graduated from the U.S. Military Academy at West Point, New York, in 1854. Methodist clergyman in Leeds, Maine, in 1860. Served in the 3rd Maine Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) from June 4, 1861, to September 3, 1861. Served as brigadier general of volunteers and commander of the 2nd and 11th U.S. Army Corps from September 3, 1861, to May 1865. Promoted to brigadier general in the U.S. Army on December 21, 1864, and breveted major general on March 13, 1865. Served as commissioner of the Bureau of Refugees, Freedmen, and Abandoned Lands from May 12, 1865, to January 1, 1869.
